724743f-a.text:
Munson Hotel and Restaurant, 533 West Street at south corner of Gansevoort Street, opposite Pier 52, North River.
May 12, 1927.
L. Sperr.
724743f-a.folder: West Street & Gansevoort Street, Manhattan, NY

710588f-a.text:
11th Avenue, north from its beginning at West and Gansevoort Streets. In the foreground is the Gansevoort Market Stand. To the left are the distinctive buildings that constitute West Washington Market. Beyond are the Hudson (North) River municipal piers that line the west side of 11th Avenue. The 11-story utilitarian structure on the right is the National Biscuit Company plant. This extends between 10th and 11th Avenues. Incidentally the latter thoroughfare begins here; converging with 11th at Delamater Square (foot of W. 13th
Street).
April 3, 1929
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
Ve N.g~ 222

710804f-b.text:
(1) West washington market at and east from the corner  of thirteenth avenue and Gansevoort street. Truck loads of crated chickens are being driven up and uploaded. April 2,1929 P. L. Sperr.

(2) the same from grace Avenue to Gansevoort street. This is the first of the five little blocks into which thirteenth Avenue, from  Gansevoort street to Bloomfield street is sudivided. (See Thompson Avenue to Hewitt Avenue, same date) April 2,1929 P. L. Sperr.

724746f-a.text:
(1)
North end of West Washington Market, West Street side, Eleventh
Avenue from Loew Avenue to Bloomfield Street.
April 2, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The northern three buildings on the West Street side, from Thompson Avenue, where the truck is emerging, to Bloomfield
Street and Pier 53, North River.
April 2, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same three blocks, seen from Gansevoort Market Stand on
the east side of West Street.
June, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

710807f-b.text:
West Washington Market, Thirteenth Ave., east side, from Hewitt Ave., to Gansevoort Street. Notice the frame shack in the foreground.
April 2, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
July.30, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A similar view of the river extremity of this whwolesale market. In this instance the view is northward, across Grace, Thompson, Hewitt
and Loew Avenues.
October 15, 1938
George D. Chinn

719994f-a.text:
A general view of West Washington Market (a wholesale produce exchange) from Gansevoort to Bloomfield Streets, as seen from the Hudson River.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

721138f-c.text:
West Washington Market: A set of 3 views of Christmas fowl at this local market which iA located at the northern terminus of West Street and opposite ansevoort Market Stand. These photographs are taken at
Loew Ave.
December 23, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
